page.title: 10Swainsthorpe Vale Hospital
page.content: The Vale Hospital was built as a Union worskhouse for the Humbleyard Church Hundred in 1835 at a cost of Â£6200. It was enlarged in 1858 having accommodation for 250 inmates. In continuous use ever since, it developed into a geriatric hospital in the 1930's and remained in use until September 1984 when it closed for economic reasons. A large three storeyed Norfolk bricked slate roofed building lying in a valley along a back road, it is a dominant feature of the area. On the ground floor are a kitchen, 3 wards each of which held 30 people, and an occupational therapy room. First floor had another 3 wards. Second floor had a laundry, meeting room, and staffroom. There were 100 staff including matron, nurses, cooks, cleaners, supervidors and office staff
